[[Ibanez]] }} '''Joseph Christopher Becker Jr.''' (born June 23, 1976, [[Chicago]], [[Illinois]], United States) is an American [[guitarist]], [[composer]] and [[multi-instrumentalist]]. ==Early life== Joe started playing guitar at the age of four years old, and was later dubbed a child prodigy after appearing on Jonathan Brandmeier's radio show at ages 7, 8 and 9.{{cite web|url=http://www.guitarplayer.com/article/mike-varneys-spotlight/Mar-05/458 |title=Electric & Acoustic Guitar Gear, Lessons, News, Blogs, Video, Tabs & Chords |publisher=GuitarPlayer.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-14}} ==Worked with== Becker has recorded with guitarists Jason Becker, Todd Duane and Joe Kelley and can be found on releases alongside : [[Eddie Van Halen]], [[Steve Vai]], [[Jason Becker]], [[Marty Friedman (guitarist)|Marty Friedman]], [[Richie Sambora]], Michael Angelo Batio, Steve Morse, Buckethead, Alex Skolnick, Bumblefoot, Blues Saraceno, Lars Eric Mattsson, Jeff Pilson, Mark Wood, Ron Keel, Randy Coven, E'nuff Z'nuff and Trixter. ==Musical style== "Becker is a very versatile and lyrical player who runs the gauntlet from shred to ear-catching, melodic instrumentals, at times bringing to mind players such as Joe Satriani and Eric Johnson" - Mike Varney, Guitar Player Magazine 2005. His guitar playing technique in particular introduces techniques characteristically advanced far beyond the styles in which he writes, such as [[tapping]] and [[sweep-picking]]. In addition to writing and recording all the music himself, he also plays all the instruments heard on his records (guitar, bass, piano, strings) with the exception of drums. Becker stopped writing, playing and recording music in 2009 for personal reasons. ==Movies and soundtracks== Becker can be heard on the soundtrack of B-Horror film, ''Evil Awakening'', a Tempe Video release. Becker's tracks "Hot As Love" and "Hard Times" were featured in the 2011 film ''The Fixer,'' from RavensFilm Productions.{{cite web|author=Nicholas J. Michalak |url=http://www.ravensfilm.com/fixer/ |title=RavensFilm Productions | THE FIXER |publisher=Ravensfilm.com |date= |accessdate=2014-06-14}} ==Personal life== Becker was married to Melissa Smith, and had two children - Joseph III and Michael. They divorced after 15 years of marriage in 2013. ==Discography== *''Hot As Love'' - Joe Becker Music - 2009 *Joe Becker & Joe Kelley, ''A Night At The White Room'' - Joe Becker Music - 2008 *''Guitar World'' Magazine March 2007 CD Rom - Future Publishing - 2007 *''Short Stories - Chops From Hell'' - 2006 *''Labour Of Love'' - 34 West Records - 2006 *''Morley Sampler CD Vol 4 ''- Morley Pedals - 2005 *''Warped Sense'' - Spinning Records / Joe Becker Music - 2004 *''Shred 101 - Chops From Hell'' - 2003 *''Warmth In The Wilderness Volume 2'' - Limpid Eye Records - 2003{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/warmth-in-the-wilderness-vol-2-a-tribute-to-jason-becker-mw0000987134 |title=Warmth in the Wilderness, Vol. 2: A Tribute to Jason Becker - Various Artists | Songs, Reviews, Credits, Awards |publisher=AllMusic |date=2002-12-31 |accessdate=2014-06-14}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://joebeckermusic.com/ Joe Becker's homepage] * [http://www.ghsstrings.com/artists/joe-becker GHS Strings Joe Becker Artist page] * [http://www.myspace.com/joebeckerdotcom Joe Becker's Official MySpace] * [http://www.myspace.com/251795305 Joe Becker's Official, "New Music" MySpace]
